title: Upvote if you want Champ Select Reports for example for "Disco Nunu"
body:
First of all for those who dont know it:

Disco Nunu is Nunu picked with clarity and clairvoience dancing (and feeding) in game under the light of clairvoience or sweeper
Disco Nunu is picked when someone else took your favourite champ/role or banned the champ you wanted to play.
Disco Nunu is picked more and more often and forces other players to leave champ select in order to not lose the game because of it.
Disco Nunu is only possible to do for Players because RIOT doesnt let us report during champ select or only punishes flaming players and refuses to ban intentional feeding players like Disco Nunu players.

They can freely do that and not a single thing is done against them and they know it. 
its getting ridicolous riot. i play around 5 games per day and in this week i have left the champ select 2 times PER DAY every day until today. i lost 13 points per day because of leaving and got plenty of penalties.

I get punished for someone elses trolling and you cant even report someone because someone has and will leave the champ select.

Btw this isnt only happening in low elo. im playing in diamond 4-3 and i've seen it in master challenger and platinum.

And you know a lot of people would report just because they don't agree

The system as it is now is being abused. Any system will be abused. It's about picking the one that is the best, not one that is perfect.

As someone who loves off meta picks (mained Urgot for 3 seasons) I'd much rather have this report option. If anyone gets upset at my pick I just tell them I know what I'm doing and most of the time they deal with it.

The way it is now we can do nothing to deal with trolls in champ select besides dodging, which will not affect the troll in any way. They're winning. We should change that. Sure, I'll get reported a little for my picks, but it'll be worth it if we get these trolls banned.

Since when did ANY champion + summoner spell(s) combination become a punishable offense in itself?
when they afk spam dance and intentionally feed, then sure.

Intentional Feeding is punishable.

When did punishment become transferable based on mere correlation?


Or, to put it another way, if a player picks Nunu, Clarity, and Clairvoyance, and then proceeds to play normally, without any in-game punishable behaviour be that intentional feeding or otherwise, is that 'disco nunu' still punishable?
In 99/100 cases if someone locks a champion into a role they do not fit with clarity and clairvoyance it is troll and they will feed or you will loose the game because of them somehow

Still just correlation.  Still founded on the dystopian concept of 'future crimes'.  Still not punishable under the Summoner's Code.

(also note that a likelyhood that 'you will loose the game because of them somehow' is _particularly_ **not punishable** - being bad at the game is not a punishable offense)
Just wait till you get them people in your ranked games and you will speak differently

If other players in my games commit punishable offenses, I report them.

Champion + summoner spell(s) combinations are not punishable offenses, no matter their correlation to possible or even probable future offenses.
So lets say you have a draven on your team who takes clairvoyance and clarity and then you loose the game and dravens score is 0/15, would you report him?

If I had reason to believe that the poor score was intentional, yes.  Because that is a reportable offense.
(I would also make the same report if we had won the game)

A Draven taking Clarity and Clairvoyance, however, is not.

I'm not even sure if manaless champions can take Clarity because I've never tried, but wouldn't you think that a Riven that takes Clarity should be instantly reported?
That's an example of a champion + summoner spell combination that is in every instance 100% troll.
What if she is a super nice Riven who gives mana to her allies? :(
I think she can actually because clarity targets not only the champion being played but can target another champion in addition, just like heal

Last I checked, 'refusal to cooperate' is not a punishable offense.

You're probably thinking of 'refusal to _communicate_'.


You are not required to take an action at the request of your team, even if it's probably a good idea, even if they 'beg' you.
You are not required to refrain from an action at the request of your team, even if it's probably a good idea, even if they 'beg' you.
**Disobeying your team is not a punishable offense.**
